column4: I don't suppose anyone knows off the top of their head which commands I need to run to reconfigure the nvidia kernel module.
I just changed to the k7 specific kernel, and currently x won't boot with the "nvidia" driver.
it's failing on the kernel module.  I know on fedora I just re-ran the .run script, but I have no idea where apt puts such things.
is it on warty or hoary
do you have the nice graphical layout with it
nice graphical layout  be more specific please.
Transgaming = the makers of wineX also known as Cedega
well in past with hoary, the graphical part wont come up, have to launch files thru console
are the programs listed in your applications menu
so how do you run your files, just curious
I guess I haven't tried Crossover since upgrading to Hoary.
after you install in hoary, you have to use it by going thru console.
you have to install all your programs when you install crossover
can you use any of your programs
currently no, but the only program I had installed on this machine was acrobat reader.
you will have to go thru console go to the file and ./file
